parameters.definition: Minimum required units of Vitamin A
Minimum required units of Vitamin D
Maximum allowed units of Vitamin E
Units of Vitamin A per cup of drink A
Units of Vitamin D per cup of drink A
Units of Vitamin E per cup of drink A
Units of Vitamin K per cup of drink A

Units of Vitamin D per cup of drink B
Units of Vitamin E per cup of drink B
Units of Vitamin K per cup of drink B

description: A nutritionist is making a special vitamin mix using two drinks: drink A and drink B. The vitamin mix must contain at least \param{MinVitA} units of Vitamin A, at least \param{MinVitD} units of Vitamin D, and at most \param{MaxVitE} units of Vitamin E. A cup of drink A contains \param{VitAA} units of Vitamin A, \param{VitDA} units of Vitamin D, \param{VitEA} units of Vitamin E, and \param{VitKA} units of Vitamin K. A cup of drink B contains \param{VitAB} units of Vitamin A, \param{VitDB} units of Vitamin D, \param{VitEB} units of Vitamin E, and \param{VitKB} units of Vitamin K. How many cups of each drink should be used to make the vitamin mix in order to minimize the amount of Vitamin K?
